Timeline.title: I build tools to solve real-world problems
lead: In racing, as in web development or engineering, I always strive for the best.
Always pushing to be better every day.

left.title: Project and Team Manager
left.description:
Project and systems engineer with end-to-end experience across the aerospace lifecycle—from flight testing to model-based systems engineering (MBSE).
Contributed to major programs (A350, avionics systems, Silvercrest turbines) with a dual technical and managerial background spanning project leadership, quality management, and international team coordination.

right.title: World Go-Kart Endurance Championship
right.description:
2015: Finished 30th out of 3,424 teams
2016: Finished 10th out of 3,424 teams

left.title: Entrepreneurial projects
left.description:
I attempted to launch several startups in the tourism and art space. Learned a lot, failed fast.
That's when I discovered my passion for coding through The Hacking Project Bootcamp.

left.title: Team Lead & Software Engineer
left.description:
Built backend features for a low-voltage cabling management platform.
Led the migration from Flash to Angular.
Managed the project and led a four-developer team.
Scaled the team's throughput 12x by redesigning workflows.

left.title: Software Engineer
left.description:
Served as a backend engineer for a medical startup focused on diagnosing heart conditions from ECG data.
Implemented new endpoints to integrate ECG data with Apple Health.
left.stack: Ruby on Rails 6.x API, RSpec, Docker, Jenkins, Sidekiq, PostgreSQL.

right.title: Volant winner
right.description: Named the winner after three days of intensive training by a jury of 24 Hours of Le Mans champions.

left.title: Fullstack Software Engineer
left.description:
Delivered engagements for several clients.
Mentored interns and apprentices.
Refactored test suites to raise coverage from 40% to 80%.
left.stack: Ruby on Rails 5.2-8.x, RSpec, Vanilla JS, PostgreSQL, Docker, Github Actions, Next.js, Angular, Vue.js.

left.title: Tech Lead
left.description:
Managed and mentored a four-person team.
Taught design patterns, OOP principles, and engineering best practices.
Designed the platform architecture.
Implemented CI/CD pipelines.
Introduced testing best practices with RSpec.
Increased automated test coverage from 10% to 60%.
Secured and handled sensitive medical data.
left.stack: Ruby on Rails 5.2-6.1, RSpec, Vanilla JS, Github Actions, PostgreSQL, Git.

right.title: French Historic Formula Ford Championship
right.description: Finished 4th overall despite running only 30% of the races. 71% podium rate.

left.title: Fullstack Software Engineer
left.description:
Served as a fullstack engineer for a medical startup streamlining communication between doctors and patients.
Owned web application features end to end.
Safeguarded sensitive medical data.
left.stack: Ruby on Rails 7.1, RSpec, Stimulus, Sidekiq, Github Actions, PostgreSQL, Redis.

BlogPage.title: Full Track Dev - Blog
description: I started writing during the various lockdowns, mostly about remote work. During my Formula Ford season, my main sponsor asked me to recap each race. Since then, blogging has become something I truly enjoy, and I share lessons here—personal and professional—across tech, remote work, and racing.

paragraphs: Since 2018, Nicolas Hermet has supported startups and scale-ups in systems engineering, then as a full-stack developer and tech lead. Full Track Dev delivers product-focused tech engagements designed to maximize ROI for your business and performance.
Even when the team is fully remote.
Recent engagements: functional architecture, retroactive time zone reconciliation, and upskilling distributed teams.

Contact.title: Contact Me
intro: Whether you have an idea brewing, need business guidance, want to kick off a build, or request an audit,
or even want to talk about a racing seat (a dream never hurts).
I would be happy to hear from you.
